This is a lightweight version that doesn't allow enumerating role\n * members except through off-chain means by accessing the contract event logs. Some\n * applications may benefit from on-chain enumerability, for those cases see\n * {AccessControlEnumerable}.\n *\n * Roles are referred to by their `bytes32` identifier. These should be exposed\n * in the external API and be unique. The best way to achieve this is by\n * using `public constant` hash digests:\n *\n * ```solidity\n * bytes32 public constant MY_ROLE = keccak256(\"MY_ROLE\");\n * ```\n *\n * Roles can be used to represent a set of permissions. To restrict access to a\n * function call, use {hasRole}:\n *\n * ```solidity\n * function foo() public {\n *     require(hasRole(MY_ROLE, msg.sender));\n *     ...\n * }\n * ```\n *\n * Roles can be granted and revoked dynamically via the {grantRole} and\n * {revokeRole} functions. Each role has an associated admin role, and only\n * accounts that have a role's admin role can call {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.\n *\n * By default, the admin role for all roles is `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`, which means\n * that only accounts with this role will be able to grant or revoke other\n * roles. More complex role relationships can be created by using\n * {_setRoleAdmin}.\n *\n * WARNING: The `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is also its own admin: it has permission to\n * grant and revoke this role. Extra precautions should be taken to secure\n * accounts that have been granted it. We recommend using {AccessControlDefaultAdminRules}\n * to enforce additional security measures for this role.\n */\nabstract contract AccessControlUpgradeable is Initializable, ContextUpgradeable, IAccessControl, ERC165Upgradeable {\n    struct RoleData {\n        mapping(address account => bool) hasRole;\n        bytes32 adminRole;\n    }\n\n    bytes32 public constant DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE = 0x00;\n\n\n    /// @custom:storage-location erc7201:openzeppelin.storage.AccessControl\n    struct AccessControlStorage {\n        mapping(bytes32 role => RoleData) _roles;\n    }\n\n    // keccak256(abi.encode(uint256(keccak256(\"openzeppelin.storage.AccessControl\")) - 1)) & ~bytes32(uint256(0xff))\n    bytes32 private constant AccessControlStorageLocation = 0x02dd7bc7dec4dceedda775e58dd541e08a116c6c53815c0bd028192f7b626800;\n\n    function _getAccessControlStorage() private pure returns (AccessControlStorage storage $) {\n        assembly {\n            $.slot := AccessControlStorageLocation\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Modifier that checks that an account has a specific role. Reverts\n     * with an {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount} error including the required role.\n     */\n    modifier onlyRole(bytes32 role) {\n        _checkRole(role);\n        _;\n    }\n\n    function __AccessControl_init() internal onlyInitializing {\n    }\n\n    function __AccessControl_init_unchained() internal onlyInitializing {\n    }\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.\n     */\n    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) public view virtual override returns (bool) {\n        return interfaceId == type(IAccessControl).interfaceId || super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`.\n     */\n    function hasRole(bytes32 role, address account) public view virtual returns (bool) {\n        AccessControlStorage storage $ = _getAccessControlStorage();\n        return $._roles[role].hasRole[account];\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Reverts with an {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount} error if `_msgSender()`\n     * is missing `role`. Overriding this function changes the behavior of the {onlyRole} modifier.\n     */\n    function _checkRole(bytes32 role) internal view virtual {\n        _checkRole(role, _msgSender());\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Reverts with an {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount} error if `account`\n     * is missing `role`.\n     */\n    function _checkRole(bytes32 role, address account) internal view virtual {\n        if (!hasRole(role, account)) {\n            revert AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(account, role);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the admin role that controls `role`. property ownership and fractional ownership\n * Implements upgradeable pattern and role-based access control\n */\ncontract PropertyNFT is\n    Initializable,\n    OwnableUpgradeable,\n regular and fractional properties\n    IMarketplace public marketplace;\n    IMarketplace public fractionalMarketplace;\n\n    // Token ID counters - separate ranges for regular and fractional properties\n    uint256 private _nextTokenId; // Starts from 1\n    uint256 private _nextFracTokenId; // Starts from 10000001\n    bytes32 public constant MINTER_ROLE = keccak256(\"MINTER_ROLE\");\n\n    // Enum to define different types of properties\n    enum PropertyType {\n        UNDEFINED,\n        APARTMENT,\n        HOUSE\n    }\n\n    // Structure to store property characteristics\n    struct Feature {\n        PropertyType propertyType;\n        string physicalAddress;\n        uint256 rooms;\n        uint256 bathrooms;\n        uint256 area;\n    }\n\n    // Mappings to store property features and blacklisted addresses\n    mapping(uint256 => Feature) public propertyFeature;\n    mapping(address => bool) private _blacklist;\n\n    // Events for tracking important contract actions\n    event Minted(address to, uint256 tokenId);\n    event BatchMinted(address to, uint256[] tokenId);\n    event Burned(address user, uint256 tokenId);\n    event BatchBurned(uint256[] tokenId);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Initializes the contract with basic settings\n     * Sets up the NFT name, symbol, and grants initial roles\n     */\n    function initialize() external initializer {\n        __ERC721_init(\"Estate PropertyNFT\", \"EPNFT\");\n        __Ownable_init(msg.sender);\n        __ERC721Enumerable_init();\n        __ERC721URIStorage_init();\n        __ERC721Pausable_init();\n        __AccessControl_init();\n\n        _nextTokenId = 1;\n        _nextFracTokenId = 10000001;\n        _grantRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, owner());\n        _grantRole(MINTER_ROLE, owner());\n    }\n\n    function pause() public onlyOwner {\n        _pause();\n    }\n\n    function unpause() public onlyOwner {\n        _unpause();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Creates a new property NFT with full ownership\n     * @param price The listing price of the property\n     * @param canBid Whether the property can receive bids\n     * @param propertyType Type of property (APARTMENT, HOUSE)\n     * @param physicalAddress Physical location of the property\n     * @param rooms Number of rooms\n     * @param bathrooms Number of bathrooms\n     * @param area Size of the property in square meters\n     */\n    function createProperty(\n        uint256 price,\n        bool canBid,\n        PropertyType propertyType,\n        string memory physicalAddress,\n        uint256 rooms,\n        uint256 bathrooms,\n        uint256 area // Area in sqm\n    ) public {\n        uint256 tokenId = _nextTokenId++;\n        _safeMint(address(marketplace), tokenId);\n        marketplace.createProperty(msg.sender, tokenId, price, canBid);\n        propertyFeature[tokenId] = Feature(propertyType, physicalAddress, rooms, bathrooms, area);\n        emit Minted(msg.sender, tokenId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Creates a new property NFT for fractional ownership\n     * Similar to createProperty but uses different token ID range and marketplace\n     */\n    function createPropertyShared(\n        uint256 price,\n        PropertyType propertyType,\n        string memory physicalAddress,\n        uint256 rooms,\n        uint256 bathrooms,\n        uint256 area // Area in sqm\n    ) public {\n        uint256 tokenId = _nextFracTokenId++;\n        _safeMint(address(fractionalMarketplace), tokenId);\n        fractionalMarketplace.createProperty(msg.sender, tokenId, price);\n        propertyFeature[tokenId] = Feature(propertyType, physicalAddress, rooms, bathrooms, area);\n        emit Minted(msg.sender, tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function burn(uint256 tokenId) public {\n        require(hasRole(MINTER_ROLE, msg.sender));\n        address user = ownerOf(tokenId);\n        _update(address(0), tokenId, user);\n        emit Burned(user, tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function burnBatch(uint256[] memory tokenIds) public {\n        require(hasRole(MINTER_ROLE, msg.sender));\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < tokenIds.length; i++) {\n            address user = ownerOf(tokenIds[i]);\n            _update(address(0), tokenIds[i], user);\n        }\n        emit BatchBurned(tokenIds);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns all token IDs owned by a specific address\n     * @param _account The address to query\n     * @return Array of token IDs owned by the address\n     * @notice May be gas intensive for addresses with many tokens\n     */\n    function tokensByAddress(address _account) external view returns (uint256[] memory) {\n        uint256 tokenCount = balanceOf(_account);\n        uint256[] memory tokenIDs = new uint256[](tokenCount);\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < tokenCount; i++) {\n            tokenIDs[i] = tokenOfOwnerByIndex(_account, i);\n        }\n        return tokenIDs;\n    }\n\n    function setTokenURI(uint256 tokenId, string memory _tokenURI) public {\n        require(hasRole(MINTER_ROLE, msg.sender));\n        _setTokenURI(tokenId, _tokenURI);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Internal function to handle token transfers\n     * Ensures transfers only occur through approved marketplace contracts\n     * and prevents blacklisted addresses from participating\n     */\n    function _update(\n        address to,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        address auth\n    ) internal override(ERC721Upgradeable, ERC721EnumerableUpgradeable, ERC721PausableUpgradeable) returns (address) {\n        require(!_blacklist[auth], \"_update: Sender is blacklisted\");\n        require(!_blacklist[to], \"_update: Recipient is blacklisted\");\n        require(\n            auth == address(marketplace) ||\n                to == address(marketplace) ||\n                auth == address(fractionalMarketplace) ||\n                to == address(fractionalMarketplace),\n            \"_update: Not allowed to transfer this NFT\"\n        );\n        return super._update(to, tokenId, auth);\n    }\n\n    function _increaseBalance(\n        address account,\n        uint128 value\n    ) internal override(ERC721Upgradeable, ERC721EnumerableUpgradeable) {\n        super._increaseBalance(account, value);\n    }\n\n    function tokenURI(\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) public view override(ERC721Upgradeable, ERC721URIStorageUpgradeable) returns (string memory) {\n        return super.tokenURI(tokenId);\n    }\n\n    function grantMinterRole(address _minter) public onlyOwner {\n        _grantRole(MINTER_ROLE, _minter);\n    }\n\n    function isBlackListed(address _account) external view returns (bool) {\n        return _blacklist[_account];\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Blacklist management functions\n     * Allows owner to restrict specific addresses from participating\n     */\n    function addToBlacklist(address _account) external onlyOwner {\n        require(!_blacklist[_account], \"Address is already blacklisted\");\n        _blacklist[_account] = true;\n    }\n\n    function removeFromBlacklist(address _account) external onlyOwner {\n        require(_blacklist[_account], \"Address is not blacklisted\");\n        _blacklist[_account] = false;\n    }\n\n    function getNextTokenId() external view returns (uint256) {\n        return _nextTokenId;\n    }\n\n    function setMarketplaceAddress(address _marketAddress) external onlyOwner {\n        marketplace = IMarketplace(_marketAddress);\n    }\n\n    function setFractionalMarketplace(address _marketAddress) external onlyOwner {\n        fractionalMarketplace = IMarketplace(_marketAddress);\n    }\n\n    // Standard override functions for compatibility with OpenZeppelin contracts\n    function supportsInterface(\n        bytes4 interfaceId\n    )\n        public\n        view\n        override(ERC721Upgradeable, ERC721EnumerableUpgradeable, ERC721URIStorageUpgradeable, AccessControlUpgradeable)\n        returns (bool)\n    {\n        return super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x855a8e220782f0462755530af02f6a29a00a4545bf84c1482f3a953b2c6e796f","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

devdoc.details: A smart contract for tokenizing real estate properties as NFTs Supports both full property ownership and fractional ownership Implements upgradeable pattern and role-based access control

AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

ERC721IncorrectOwner(address,uint256,add.details: Indicates an error related to the ownership over a particular token. Used in transfers.

params.owner: Address of the current owner of a token.
params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC721InsufficientApproval(address,uint2.details: Indicates a failure with the `operator`s approval. Used in transfers.

params.operator: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC721InvalidApprover(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.

ERC721InvalidOperator(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `operator` to be approved. Used in approvals.

params.operator: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC721InvalidOwner(address).details: Indicates that an address can't be an owner. For example, `address(0)` is a forbidden owner in ERC-20. Used in balance queries.

params.owner: Address of the current owner of a token.

ERC721InvalidReceiver(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.

params.receiver: Address to which tokens are being transferred.

ERC721InvalidSender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC721NonexistentToken(uint256).details: Indicates a `tokenId` whose `owner` is the zero address.

ERC721OutOfBoundsIndex(address,uint256).details: An `owner`'s token query was out of bounds for `index`. NOTE: The owner being `address(0)` indicates a global out of bounds index.

EnforcedPause().details: The operation failed because the contract is paused.

ExpectedPause().details: The operation failed because the contract is not paused.

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `owner` enables `approved` to manage the `tokenId` token.

ApprovalForAll(address,address,bool).details: Emitted when `owner` enables or disables (`approved`) `operator` to manage all of its assets.

BatchMetadataUpdate(uint256,uint256).details: This event emits when the metadata of a range of tokens is changed. So that the third-party platforms such as NFT market could timely update the images and related attributes of the NFTs.

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

MetadataUpdate(uint256).details: This event emits when the metadata of a token is changed. So that the third-party platforms such as NFT market could timely update the images and related attributes of the NFT.

Paused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `tokenId` token is transferred from `from` to `to`.

Unpaused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`.

addToBlacklist(address).details: Blacklist management functions Allows owner to restrict specific addresses from participating

createProperty(uint256,bool,uint8,string.details: Creates a new property NFT with full ownership

params.area: Size of the property in square meters
params.canBid: Whether the property can receive bids
params.price: The listing price of the property

createPropertyShared(uint256,uint8,strin.details: Creates a new property NFT for fractional ownership Similar to createProperty but uses different token ID range and marketplace

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

initialize().details: Initializes the contract with basic settings Sets up the NFT name, symbol, and grants initial roles

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

tokensByAddress(address).details: Returns all token IDs owned by a specific address

returns._0: Array of token IDs owned by the address

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
